item.title: Harmful Habits in Children
item.dc:creator: vmd

item.content:encoded:
Harmful habits have negative impact on teeth and their supporting structures (bone and gums).

Some of the harmful habits in children are :

Thumb sucking :

Children usually pick this habit when they are about 3 or 4 years old. If the child carries this habit beyond this age, it turns to be harmful as it causes misalignment of teeth. If the child is deprived of parental love , care and affection, he or she may grow insecurity and ultimately grow this habit of thumb sucking. Another reason to develop this habit could be hunger.

Effects of Thumb Sucking on Your Child :

  • Causes forward placement of teeth.
  • Gap between the upper and lower teeth is increased which eventually causes gap between lips
  • The upper front teeth becomes flared
  • Upper jaw becomes narrow

How to remove this habit :

  • By psychological approach, you can divert your child’s attention to other things such as play and toys.
  • By chemical approach, you can place bitter tasting preparation like pepper or asafoetida.

Mouth breathing :

Instead of breathing from nose, child breaths from mouth. You can easily detect that your child is mouth breather. Some of the features

  • Child’s lips are dry and chapped.
  • Nose and nasal passage looks narrow.
  • Face will look long and narrow.
  • Pigeon shaped chest.
  • Child will look bluish due to the increased amount of CO2 as filtration decreases (due to breathing from mouth instead of nose).

Management of Mouth breathing

  • The narrow upper jaw is corrected by the orthodontist by jaw expansion.
  • If there is any nasal obstruction it is removed surgically.

Tongue Thrusting :

This habit can be seen in any age group. It is a habit in which the person places the tongue between their teeth during swallowing, speaking etc. The reasons could be improper bottle feeding, prolonged thumb sucking, prolonged upper respiratory infection and due to large tongue.

Impacts of Tongue Thrusting :

  • Anterior open bite.
  • The front teeth shift forward
  • Upper jaw becomes narrow and shifts forward

How to Manage tongue thrust –

  • The way of swallowing should be corrected.
  • The teeth positions should be corrected by the dentist.
  • Need a dental treatment

Grinding of teeth (Bruxism) –

For a non-functional purpose (not chewing or eating), if the child grinds his or her teeth, it’s a harmful habit.

Impacts of Grinding teeth:

  • Teeth gets attrited.
  • The height of the teeth reduces.
  • It causes sensitivity to the teeth.
  • Causes pain in gums.
  • Teeth becomes mobile.

Management of Bruxism:

  • It is mainly due to stress, so stress should be reduced by relaxing.
  • The dentist will provide you the orthodontic appliance( night guard, occlusal splint), which protects the teeth.
